Medical contraindications and precautions for immunizations are based upon the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices (ACIP) Comprehensive General Recommendations and Guidelines , published by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. A contraindication is a condition in a recipient that inc reases the risk for a serious vaccine adverse event (VAE) or compromises the ability of the vaccine to produce immunity. A precaution is a condition in a recipient that might increase the risk for a serious VAE or that might compromise the ability of the vaccine to produce immunity. Under normal conditions, vaccinations are deferred when a precaution is self -limiting, but can be administered if the precaution condition improves.
